page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The D-Block is divided into 3 distinct areas: urban development in the SE corner around the village of Stalham; the marshy borders of the River Ant in the west and the arable which comprises the rest. The dominant industry is agriculture but due to increasing mechanisation, it employs a diminishing work-force. In spite of this, the population has rapidly expanded with the arrival of large numbers of residents from outside the area and who commute daily to urban centres of work. This is reflected in all aspects of life.
